results.title: Ingredients of an effective speech
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
‘Ingredients of a speech’ addresses speaking rate, volume, voice projection, use of light and shade and the use of pausing for delivering an effective speech.

results.title: Ingmar Bergman
results.creator_credit: Svenska filminstitutet, Stattan Hedqvist and Stig Bjorkman
results.brief_description: Ingmar Bergman is widely acknowledged by film critics as adopting an intellectual stance towards film making, as well as being one of the great directors of actors. This documentary includes clips from his films and indicates his working relationships with actors. The film also brings out the requirements involved in being a film director. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Inganarr the giant serpent
results.creator_credit: Australian National University, Educational Media Australia and Ken J. Widdowson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Aboriginal legends”.
A serpent with an enormous appetite, Inganarr, ate all the people of North Goulburn Island and then proceeded to eat the people of Arnhem Land. Fortunately Inganarr suffered from indigestion due to his gluttony and the tribespeople poured out of his mouth in droves. This helps to explain why there are people in eastern Arnhem Land but no people in western Arnhem Land. This film is also available as a compilation film entitled Aboriginal legends no. 3. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Information technology
results.creator_credit: Yorkshire Television, Adam Hart-Davis and Colin Nobbs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematical eye”.
Provides the student with an introduction to common computer-related terms such as databases and fields, and considers capturing and storing data in a usable form. Explains how computers sort data to produce useful output and briefly examines computer aided design and manufacture.

results.title: Information processing (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Communication Research Media Productions, Carole Hart and Bruce Hart
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology Today”.
Using for its base a crowded noisy cocktail party as observed from a control booth, analyses how people process information. Pretty girls and bizarrely dressed men demonstrate attention, language processing, long and short term memory, mnemonics, retrieval strategies, and problem solving.

results.title: Inflation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
A review of inflation covering a definition of terms, general and specific causes and measurement. Understanding this topic is a basic requirement for further study in the area of unemployment and prices policy.

results.title: Infinite journey
results.brief_description: Man’s historical aspiration to reach the moon and the world’s involvement in the Apollo 11 flight are the themes of this film, which are placed in the context of the historical aspiration and scientific genius of many lands which made them possible. Also focuses on the Gemini flights. Introduced by Richard Nixon and narrated by Gregory Peck.

results.title: Infield play at 1st and 3rd
results.creator_credit: American and National Leagues of Professional Baseball Clubs
results.brief_description: Instructional film for intending infield players at first and third base. Some very fine slow-motion footage reveals that wealth of delicate grace otherwise latent in baseball’s gymnastic protocols.
